      Calculates the cumulative (ongoing) sum of a matrix's elements. For example, cumsum(mat[1,2,3]) would return mat[1,3,6]. Assumes matrix type is convertible to double.

      static <T,U> java.util.List<U> mapColsToList(Matrix<T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super golem.matrix.Matrix<T>,? extends U> f)
      Takes each col in a matrix, passes them through f, and puts the outputs into a List. In contrast to this#mapCols, the usage of a list as the output container allows for arbitrary output types, such as taking a double matrix and returning a list of strings.
      static <T> Matrix<T> mapMat(Matrix<T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,? extends T> f)
      Takes each element in a matrix, passes them through f, and puts the output of f into an output matrix. This process is done in row-major order.

      • cumsum

        public static Matrix<java.lang.Double> cumsum(Matrix<java.lang.Double> arr)

        Calculates the cumulative (ongoing) sum of a matrix's elements. For example, cumsum(mat[1,2,3]) would return mat[1,3,6].

        @param arr The matrix to calculate the cumsum on. Sum will be computed in row-major order.

        @return A 1x(arr.numRows*arr.numCols) vector storing the ongoing cumsum.

      • format

        public static void format(java.lang.String formatStr)

        Sets the format for Golem to display numbers in. For example, calling

        format("long") println(randn(3))

        will cause println(someMatrix) to show more decimals (precision) than

        format("short") println(randn(3))

        format() must be called before a .toString() request to a Golem matrix in order to have any effect, but setting it will persist for all printing of matrices until called again with a different format string. The default setting is "long". Supported options are "long", "short", "verylong".

      • mapCols

        public static <T> Matrix<T> mapCols(Matrix<T> $receiver,
                                    kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super golem.matrix.Matrix<T>,? extends golem.matrix.Matrix<T>> f)

        Takes each col in a matrix, passes them through f, and puts the output of f into a col of an output matrix.

        Parameters:
        f - A function that takes in a Nx1 col and returns a Mx1 col. Note that all output cols must be the same length. In addition, the input and output element types must be the same.
        Returns:
        the new matrix after each col is mapped through f

      • mapColsToList

        public static <T,U> java.util.List<U> mapColsToList(Matrix<T> $receiver,
                                                    kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super golem.matrix.Matrix<T>,? extends U> f)

        Takes each col in a matrix, passes them through f, and puts the outputs into a List. In contrast to this#mapCols, the usage of a list as the output container allows for arbitrary output types, such as taking a double matrix and returning a list of strings.

        Parameters:
        f - A function that takes in a Nx1 col and returns a Mx1 col. Note that all output cols must be the same length.

      • mapMat

        public static <T> Matrix<T> mapMat(Matrix<T> $receiver,
                                   kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,? extends T> f)

        Takes each element in a matrix, passes them through f, and puts the output of f into an output matrix. This process is done in row-major order.

        Parameters:
        f - A function that takes in an element and returns an element
        Returns:
        the new matrix after each element is mapped through f

      • mapMatIndexed

        public static <T> Matrix<T> mapMatIndexed(Matrix<T> $receiver,
                                          kotlin.jvm.functions.Function3<? super java.lang.Integer,? super java.lang.Integer,? super T,? extends T> f)

        Takes each element in a matrix, passes them through f, and puts the output of f into an output matrix. This process is done in row-major order.

        Parameters:
        f - A function that takes in an element and returns an element. Function also takes in the row, col index of the element's location.
        Returns:
        the new matrix after each element is mapped through f

      • mapRows

        public static <T> Matrix<T> mapRows(Matrix<T> $receiver,
                                    kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super golem.matrix.Matrix<T>,? extends golem.matrix.Matrix<T>> f)

        Takes each row in a matrix, passes them through f, and puts the output of f into a row of an output matrix.

        Parameters:
        f - A function that takes in a 1xN row and returns a 1xM row. Note that all output rows must be the same length. In addition, the input and output element types must be the same.
        Returns:
        the new matrix after each row is mapped through f

      • mapRowsToList

        public static <T,U> java.util.List<U> mapRowsToList(Matrix<T> $receiver,
                                                    kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super golem.matrix.Matrix<T>,? extends U> f)

        Takes each row in a matrix, passes them through f, and puts the outputs into a List. In contrast to this#mapRows, the usage of a list as the output container allows for arbitrary output types, such as taking a double matrix and returning a list of strings.

        Parameters:
        f - A function that takes in a 1xN row and returns a 1xM row. Note that all output rows must be the same length.

      • to2DArray
